intro: Phytolacca meziana, commonly known as the Mexican pokeweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Americas. It features tall, erect stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, often with a reddish hue. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, followed by dark purple berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a waxy texture with a distinctive scent. Phytolacca meziana is often found in disturbed soils and thrives in moist, sunny environments.
